Detailed Description

template<typename VarRef1, typename VarRef2, typename VarRef3>
struct ProductConstraint< VarRef1, VarRef2, VarRef3 >

var1 * var2 = var3

constraints;product Description The constraint

product(x,y,z)

ensures that z=xy in any solution. constraints;product Notes This constraint can be used for (and, in fact, has a specialised implementation for) achieving boolean AND, i.e. x & y=z can be modelled as

product(x,y,z)

The general constraint achieves bounds generalised arc consistency for positive numbers.

Gets all the triggers a constraint wants to set up.

This function shouldn't do any propagation. That is full_propagate's job.

Definition at line 163 of file constraint_product.h.

template<typename VarRef1, typename VarRef2, typename VarRef3>
virtual bool ProductConstraint< VarRef1, VarRef2, VarRef3 >::get_satisfying_assignment ( box< pair< int, DomainInt > > &  assignment  )  [inline, virtual]

Looks for a valid partial assignment to a constraint.

The return value (in the box) is pairs of <varnum, domain value>, where varnum is in the same position as returned by get_vars.
